storyInfo: Talulah paints a picture of the future that may impress FrostNova, but it doesn't seem to convince Patriot. In an encounter with the Ursus garrison, Talulah finally witnesses Patriot in a fight.

attributes.content: Hui-chieh:
Back when I first became Infected, my mind wasn't clear on anything.
I knew Kashchey wanted to use me to do so much, but I was always afraid. What was it he wanted me to do?
Had he planned some kind of trick, one to destroy in a blink of an eye the network of Infected I'd spent so much time setting up?
Or had he planned to let me divide the Infected? Let them drift into two camps, the urbanites and the settlers?
Or the even more frightening scenarioâ€”perhaps he'd planned for the Infected to become a new army, and for Ursus to be plunged into war once more?
I could only speculate. He hung over my head like a murky specter, impossible to chase off.
But I could only move onward.
One of the Yetis, apparently called Petrova, used cystymilk yesterday to stir-fry oilseeds. A strange recipe, for sure. The taste was pretty interesting.
Oh, that... I remember that. The time's gone so fast. It's been two whole years.
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: Are the stories the fighters passed around true, then? You really fought with her? From the sound of it, you both blew the entire city ruins into oblivion.
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: It wasn't that dramatic. Rumors always get more outlandish as time goes on... all I did was melt her Originium ice crystals.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Sashenka, no running around! You'll slip!
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: Look at them, just free to live. It's so nice.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: It's a duty of mine.
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: I never imagined you'd volunteer to teach the children.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: I get along a lot better with the children than I do with Ursus. What was that about melting, just now?
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: FrostNova's Originium ice crystals. A sort of Arts device her squad used, by my guess.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: That's something... I'm sure FrostNova didn't like it.
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: *chuckle*. Nope. I took a single breath, and she froze half my body.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: And when I finally snapped out of it, she was already charging me, going for the neck with an ice blade.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: I blocked it, took in the hissing sound, and this sword tasted frost for the first time in all its years.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: It was probably a first for her, too, meeting someone who could chip her blade...
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Ah, you're pretty happy to talk about this. Are you proud of it, maybe?
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: Not really... yeah maybe you are right... uh. That child. The one hiding behind the wood fence. What's her name?
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Lyubov. That's enough spying on us, Liuba! I'll read a story for you all next period.
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: That's right, a story all about an old ghost in the gray forest... a scary story!
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: Could you help bring me some wood shavings? Put them in a basket. Thank you.
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: So then?
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: FrostNova... Alina, you know it's FrostNova we're talking about. Her name spread among the Casters of the Northwestern Tundra long before mine ever did.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: I thought you didn't like it when people spoke your name.
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: If anyone ever uses it to threaten, then of course I won't be happy. But if hearing my name makes them want to challenge me, then that's not too shabby.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Nothing like you. I don't think FrostNova ever gives challenges the time of day. Thinking about it that way, you really stoked her fire, didn't you?
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: She's the top of the Infected Casters, the top squad commander, and the strongest of the Infected's warriors to boot.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: ...Don't misunderstand. It's not like that's what I aim for.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Plenty of people think you resemble each other in places, though. Some of the children say they want to be like FrostNova, and some of them say they want to be a hero like you.
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: Time out, time out. Now that's a word I'm not happy with. How about you, Alina? What do you think?
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: No two people are alike, in my eyes.
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: Figured you'd say something like that.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Truth be told, I don't really know what FrostNova's life was like as a child. She's been brought up well. It was probably alright.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: But don't let any child experience the things I did.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: You've been brought up well, too.
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: I don't want to talk about it.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: ...Talulah, none of us know the bitter things the world has in store for them, nor whether those things will be even more absurd than what we've already seen.
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: Well, that's depressing.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: It's also the reason I wanted to be a teacher.
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: My 'teacher' wasn't anything like you, for sure.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: ...I get what you mean, now. You're saying maybe FrostNova also had, well...
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Who knows. No two Infected live identical lives.
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: Well, to wrap up, I never slacked on practicing technique again after my dispute with FrostNova. Not just Arts, my swordsmanship too. Like hell she'll ever best me again in either.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: I know you and her fought. What about after that?
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: It took until her anger abated before she told me she wasn't the one responsible.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Then that only leaves one person who could've been.
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: You're right on the mark, yes. It wasn't too long after our scuffle finished...
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: ...that out from another end of the city, came a...
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: ...person.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Is remembering it that much effort?
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: I should say, that first impression was too shocking. I'm scrambling to find the words for you.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: The broad midday light spilled over his body, but couldn't melt away the black, black as tar.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: I was in the middle of telling FrostNova about my project. I'd gotten up to where I was in contact with Infected in other cities.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: I wanted to assemble the funds to construct or seek out a small-scale nomadic city, and invited them to join the project...
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: I saw his shadow. I couldn't keep speaking.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: What stopped you?
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: I'm not THAT confident in myself.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Not that confident? I've never seen you short of confidence before.
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: I mean, this was... Patriot.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: You couldn't talk him over.
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: I still haven't to this day.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: You already know all the rest. After FrostNova and I had our 'friendly discussion,' our group successfully joined up with the guerrillas.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Good for us. All else aside, after hearing we could go with the guerrillas, plenty of our Infected here were happy beyond belief.
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: These last two years have been better to us than before. You made a good choice. You're finally in the right, Talulah.
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: I mean... the way I see it, the guerrillas definitely didn't care about me or the other Infected fighters, they just... couldn't ignore the rest of the Infected, traveling with us.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Then that's even less reason to be down about it. You thought the same way, after all.
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: But it's been two years. The situation hasn't made any headway at all.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Think about it this way, Talulah. From what moment did you start feeling Patriot didn't approve of you?
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: Over a year ago... not long after we joined up with the guerrillas. All the way up until now.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Not happening.
attributes.name: FrostNova

attributes.content: We don't even know how many more Infected are out on the tundra under Ursus's wretched rule. It's too early yet to be talking with the guerrillas about the Infected in the cities.
attributes.name: FrostNova

attributes.content: We're not intending to abandon the tundra's Infected. Why would I have brought them with me, otherwise?
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Sooner or later will come the day we return. Our objective is to have Ursus's, no, the entire world's Infected come together...
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: We may be in differing places, but our lack of resignation to our circumstances is one and the same, indistinguishable.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: A friend of mine in a certain city calls that kind of behavior 'reunion.'
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: He calls on the Infected to come together, naming it the 'Reunion Movement,' revolving around one identical belief, protesting against Ursus's cruel rule over the Infected.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: And we should get the chance to protest the Ursus soldiers on the tundra about the exploitation in the mines, but I can't say it'd make them turn over a new leaf.
attributes.name: FrostNova

attributes.content: Talulah, forget the common people for a moment. Talk about the soldiers. The Ursus Army wouldn't let a single one of us go.
attributes.name: FrostNova

attributes.content: If you want to go south to 'protest,' we could just save ourselves the trouble and find a division to kill us.
attributes.name: FrostNova

attributes.content: Ursus is not a single-minded entity. This is our chance. What the Reunion Movement aims to do is pass on the belief, but I see even more opportunities in it. We have our own signal to send.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: What signal?
attributes.name: FrostNova

attributes.content: 'You are not alone.'
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: You know better than I do that staying on the tundra is a life of attrition, eating away at our strength. We need to go beyond it.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: I don't decide this stuff.
attributes.name: FrostNova

attributes.content: You're still not willing to decide it.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: If the price of leaving is death, then my life never had much use outside of taking down an Ursus soldier or two.
attributes.name: FrostNova

attributes.content: But what about the people around us?
attributes.name: FrostNova

attributes.content: Talulah, you haven't got brothers and sisters by your side. I'm not going to let mine throw away their lives.
attributes.name: FrostNova

attributes.content: But I think the other part's right.
attributes.name: FrostNova

attributes.content: Which part?
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Telling the Infected they're not alone.
attributes.name: FrostNova

attributes.content: We've spent too much time on one thing, here on the tundra.
attributes.name: FrostNova

attributes.content: Seeking friends.
attributes.name: FrostNova

attributes.content: But linking up with the city Infected?
attributes.name: FrostNova

attributes.content: Guess people from the big city really do like to dream a little bigger.
attributes.name: FrostNova

attributes.content: I don't need you mocking me yet, FrostNova.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: I'm not mocking you. You're so strong. You've taken all of them a long, long way, just like us.
attributes.name: FrostNova

attributes.content: But it's a dream, going south, trust me.
attributes.name: FrostNova

attributes.content: The guerrilla force grows, but we're Infected.
attributes.name: FrostNova

attributes.content: We don't have many years left... and your alliance would need plenty of years, at least...
attributes.name: FrostNova

attributes.content: And that's precisely whyâ€”
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Dad?
attributes.name: FrostNova

attributes.content: Ah...
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Mr. Patriot?
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Patriot sits down by the bonfire. Like Talulah simulated over and over in her mind, Patriot simply sits down, wordless, and gazes into the fire.
You're good. Keep going.
attributes.name: FrostNova

attributes.content: It's precisely because we don't have many years left.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: The south has fields of bumper crops, suitable temperatures, four seasons to tell apart, and all sorts of fresh food.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Resources, education, prospects...
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: And a future.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: â€”Future?
attributes.name: FrostNova

attributes.content: FrostNova, there's every likelihood I know what you're thinking.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: What I'm thinking is written on my face. I don't know anything you'd call a 'future.'
attributes.name: FrostNova

attributes.content: We may not have much time left at all. There's only so many places it'd let us set foot.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: But the Infected should have a future. For the future Infected, for those who come after us.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: FrostNova... we'll find those Infected a home.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Somewhere Ursus and the Infected Patrol Unit won't disturb. Somewhere the Ursus armies can't surround.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: And you know for sure, taking the Infected with us would get in the way of the guerrillas' operations. But we won't abandon them.
attributes.name: FrostNova

attributes.content: It'll be a seriously difficult path.
attributes.name: FrostNova

attributes.content: At the very least, what hopes we bring about before we die can be left to others.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: And, if we overthrow Ursus's present system over the Infected...
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Everything will change.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: We're thin on the ground.
attributes.name: FrostNova

attributes.content: If you weren't an Infected, would you shake my hand?
attributes.name: FrostNova

attributes.content: We'd start from a handshake, in that case.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: ...What you're saying is probably...
attributes.name: FrostNova

attributes.content: Dad? Where are you going?
attributes.name: FrostNova

attributes.content: I've had enough.
attributes.name: Patriot

attributes.content: Sir...
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Hey.
attributes.name: FrostNova

attributes.content: Don't mind it too much.
attributes.name: FrostNova

attributes.content: He was probably just thinking it over.
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: He's been thinking it over for ages, if so.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: It's been two years, and the only conversations we've ever had have been about team composition and following plans. He's never asked me once about anything to do with any project.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Talulah, no matter if he's ridiculing you or opposing youâ€”ah, not that I think he's the type to really ridicule other peopleâ€”you're still going to wait forever. Am I right, or not?
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: If we want to leave the tundra, we need the power of the guerrillas. I'll keep at it.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Because he's the hope of the tundra's Infected?
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: I thought you didn't say things like that. I mean, you never... you don't say things like that, right?
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: I just want to know what your thought process is like.
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: ...I thinkâ€”it's because he's the symbol the tundra's Infected unite behind.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: A symbol with no way of passing on to the next generation.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Get up! How long are you planning to stay there?
attributes.name: FrostNova

attributes.content: You gave me a chill, you goddamned white rabbit...!
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: I don't care how stick thin you are, don't tell me this cold front's too much for you!
attributes.name: FrostNova

attributes.content: You sure weren't saying that when you iced these Ursus weapons.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Brothers and sisters, withdraw! Let them follow! Draw out the mine guards!
attributes.name: FrostNova

attributes.content: Just hold on until the Shieldguards can support us! Don't lose hope!
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: â€”Pace. Pick it up. Faster. The guerrillas are in place to get the mine guards double-teamed.
attributes.name: FrostNova

attributes.content: How do you figureâ€”wait.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Those strange Originium ornaments. Did the guerrillas arrange those?
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Those were set up for my father.
attributes.name: FrostNova

attributes.content: The Ursus army isn't pursuing us anymore. Seems like they're really not a fan of what those entail.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Wait, are... are these some kind of Sarkaz thing?
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: His Sarkaz ceremony. These two are the best we could make with what we had on hand.
attributes.name: FrostNova

attributes.content: Patriot... is Patriot here?
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: You said it yourself. You were expecting our team to be surprise-attacked. And if we wanted to annihilate their whole company, of course we'd come up short if we only relied on our squad.
attributes.name: FrostNova

attributes.content: ...They're already beginning to rout.
attributes.name: FrostNova

attributes.content: Have you ever seen my father in battle before, Talulah...?
attributes.name: FrostNova

attributes.content: The... him... It's him... Why did none of you sâ€”say... say he was here?!
attributes.name: Local Ursus Troop

attributes.content: Retreat! Retreat! Just forget them, forget them!
attributes.name: Local Ursus Troop

attributes.content: Wait, hold on! He's coming from the rear? Then what's all this in front of us?
attributes.name: Local Ursus Troop

attributes.content: Hello? Hello? ! Say something! Say something!
attributes.name: Local Ursus Troop

attributes.content: Until those local troops let loose their violence upon him, the Sarkaz who towered over all others makes no move, nor does he make a sound.
Yet Talulah hears, laced through the north wind of the tundra, something not unlike cries. The shudders of the world itself, its wickedness cowering back, step after step, before the Wendigo.
Patriot stands fast, and casts toward the tundra a long halberd.
And in the gloom of a sky that knows only to devour all life, suddenly, a chasm is cut.
